snippet: While Harvard professors oppose changes that will raise their health care costs, the university says the increases are in part a result of the Affordable Care Act, which many Harvard experts championed.
abstract: Harvard University will proceed with cost increases for faculty health care, despite overwhelming opposition from professors; administrators note that changes are in part the result of the Affordable Care Act, which many Harvard experts had championed; professors had until now avoided the national trend of rising health care costs.
lead_paragraph: While Harvard professors oppose changes that will raise their health care costs, the university says the increases are in part a result of the Affordable Care Act, which many Harvard experts championed.

headline.main: Harvard Ideas on Health Care Hit Home, Hard
headline.print_headline: Harvard Ideas on Health Care Hit Home, Hard

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
